title: Apple quietly launches $400 AirPods Pro
text:
San Francisco | Apple has announced the AirPods Pro, a higher-end version of its popular wireless headphones that add noise cancellation, water resistance and a new design.

The model priced at $US249 ($399 in Australia) will sell alongside the current $US159 version that launched in March, and marks the first time that Apple is segmenting its AirPods line in a significant way.

The new AirPods Pro cost $399 in Australia and will begin shipping on October 30. Apple

The new model includes interchangeable flexible tips to improve their fit. That addresses a criticism of the original design, which first debuted in 2016, and also helps enable the noise cancellation feature for improved audio quality.

The Pro model has a feature called Adaptive EQ, which automatically tunes songs for better sound and has an updated touch-sensitive stem that allows users to switch between noise cancellation mode and transparency mode, to be able to hear around you.

The new model will begin shipping on October 30, Apple said in a statement on Monday. The water-resistance should make the AirPods a better option for athletes, pitting them against the latest offerings from Apple's Beats brand.
description: The new higher-end model includes interchangeable flexible tips to improve fit and enable the noise cancellation feature for improved audio quality.
